A5_ADD_FIELDS_TO_TABLE Function L a5_add_fields_to_table(C tablename ,C new_field_list )
tablename The name of the table to receive the new field(s). Character
new_field_list A CR-LF delimited list of one or more field entries. Each entry has the same format as when adding a new field through the Restructure Table dialog box. The format for each field entry as is as follows: Field_Name as C, Field_Type as C [, Width as N [, Decimals as N ]].
Adds fields to a table. New_fields is a crlf list of fields to be added in format: fieldname,type,size,decimals

Field Functions and Methods
Field_List Argument Description Field_Name A name starting with a letter (A-Z or a-z) and composed of letters, numbers (0-9), and underscore (_) characters. Field_Type One of the following values:
"activex" = ActiveX
"bitmap" = Windows Bitmap image field
"C" = character
"D" = date
"E" = exponent
"image" = image file reference
"jpeg" = JPEG image field
"L" = logical
"N" = numeric
"M" = memo
"ole" = OLE
"R" = RTF memo
"T" = time
"Y" = short time Width Required for character and numeric fields. The total width of the field, including, if numeric, decimal point and decimal character positions. Decimals Only applicable to Numeric. The number of decimal character positions.
Description The A5_ADD_FIELDS_TO_TABLE() function adds field(s) to an existing table. Limitations: Desktop applications only Example dim tbl as P tbl = table.open("product") ? tbl.fields_get() = 7.000000 a5_add_fields_to_table("product", "junk,C,0") ? tbl.fields_get() = 8.000000
